Edited January 20, 2020 by Guest

The double magazine? I just needed something to stop the round from straying out of the chambers (i.e. landing gears). Also, I made sure that the round's length was enough to help it not stray out of the barrel while not impede its entry. That's why I opted to use semi-smart rounds which used an RCS tank instead of an Oscar-B, and a flat probe. And about the launch, I can launch the vehicle by making sure that all the textures are dropped down to increase the framerate from 20 to (at least) 40. Well.. that's how I tried to launch the first MACV.

Landing gear, why didn't I think of that! And I'll send you a private message with a download to my lifter so you can test it for me. It's pretty stable, I just worry if it's got enough lift to get it into space. I did a little testing myself, and it managed to lift a Orange tank to 100km orbit no problem, and it lifted my Baldr Mk1 to a 100km as well, but I had a near catastrophic failure when the rocket almost tipped over at around 20,000m up.

Initial testing with the "Dante" Armor Combustion Apparatus has yielded poor results, with the targets being pushed away in zero-g. Nevertheless, results were gained and will be put to use in our new "Illusion" weapon.

KRS Derian, a support carrier ready to support any company willing to buy the ship design.

We don't want it, our computers can't handle such rocketry. We'd like it if anyone else will be willing to use it, if any bidders are interested, please reply with information of your company.

KRS Derian, a support carrier ready to support any company willing to buy the ship design.

the video is a broken link
I think i fixed it, try it now

Hey guys...

The KingPanzer Z

... Turrets are overrated. You can't even elevate the gun. With an SPG, on the other hand...

Spiritwolf, bring one of these to any land battle and vicory is assured!
If their was ever a war machine, this is it
Nice - same principle as that Swedish tank design. Very good!

I have tried a variety of engines at all lengths of visible exhaust plume.

I have been able to explode tanks and soft components ... the bigger the thrust the faster it happens .... but no viable directed energy weapon designs yet.

Spin arm raming nacelles on the other hand work well. Get up close ... lots of reaction torque and you can strike again and again.

So damage can occur to the nacelle .. and I have been meaning to investigate a system of ablative plates on senior docking ports. The strikes thus occur on axis of the docking port.

[redacted]

Edited February 21, 2014 by Khobai

Re-introducing the Dagger class support vessel to this thread.

This prototype was built by our finest engineers who ensured that the armour had no defects. ie. craft file editing

This is my second ship in the development of more effective ship design. Instead of a bridge/birds nest it's an armoured pod and there's also backup engines.

It's 185 parts unloaded, the current launch system isn't the most reliable and it shoots itself if you're careless.
I want the design i can handle it my email is [email protected]

Added new weaponry to the KingPanzer: Three 5 ton, 1,000mm Missiles.

Each missile is guided and restartable in filght. Range of 6-15 KM. Easy to fly, ASAS keeps them steady.

This is a Medium scout tank, the Swordfish, after two hits. One bounced off the rear, almost flipping the tank and causing massive damage to the rear port wheels, one went straight into the turret, cracking it open and wrecking the tank.

Gun in the turret has been mulched.

Added new weaponry to the KingPanzer: Three 5 ton, 1,000mm Missiles.

"You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to zekes again."

I forgot to add pictures of the frigate, didn't I?

Here is the newest addition to the Conrixian Orbital Navy. It is recorded as the largest fighter ever built by the empire.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

the biggest implementation to the fighter is the new EDS, or Emergency Detachment System. this implant allows the pilot to jettison the hull if critical damage had been received. After the ship is jettisoned, the cockpit can be controlled by a Mono-Drive.
